Personal Injury • Weather Disputes • Altitude Law

The sky betrayed me.
The law won't.

Whitford & Rising operates exclusively above 1,200 feet. We believe justice, like warm air, rises. Founded by former Channel 9 Chief Meteorologist Dale C. Whitford after what the media unfairly called "The Eleven-Day Lie."

147 cases won at cruising altitude • 0 meetings held on the ground since 2019

001 — The Founder

I predicted the storm of the century.
The century wasn't ready.

For sixteen years I told central Ohio what the sky was planning. I was right every single time. The storm of August 2019 was real. I felt it in the barometric pressure, in the way the cumulus stacked at 4:47 PM on a Tuesday. I told them to board their windows. I told them for eleven days.

The sun shone all eleven days. The county spent $4.2 million on emergency preparations. Channel 9 used the word "fabrication." My wife used the word "delusional." The Ohio State Bar Association, surprisingly, used the word "welcome."

I passed the bar exam in nine weeks. I had something to prove — not to the public, not to Channel 9, but to the sky itself. If it wouldn't give me a storm, I would become one.

NOTE: Dale C. Whitford is not "disgraced." Dale C. Whitford was ahead of schedule. The storm will come. It is merely 7 years late. — Office of the Managing Partner

002 — Areas of Practice

We see your case from above.

01

Personal Injury

Slip-and-falls, car accidents, workplace incidents. We handle them all from 1,200 feet, where the details become small and the justice becomes clear.

02

Atmospheric Defamation

Were you publicly shamed for a weather prediction? Did a news station call you a liar on a broadcast seen by 340,000 households? We understand.

03

Wrongful Sunshine

When clear skies cause measurable emotional and financial harm. Ohio recognizes this as a tort since 2021. We wrote the brief.

04

Divorce & Custody

All mediation conducted at altitude. Studies show couples are 62% less likely to raise their voices at 3,000 feet due to mild hypoxia. We call this "therapeutic elevation."

05

Estate Planning

Clients consistently report that viewing their property from above gives them "a new perspective on what really matters." Their words. We just fly the balloon.

06

Barometric Negligence

Holding weather stations accountable for faulty pressure readings. Landmark case: Whitford v. The Sky (2022, ongoing, 4 appeals).

003 — Office Protocol

All meetings are at altitude.
No exceptions.

I.
Consultations begin at takeoff. The balloon departs from the Whitford & Rising launch pad (formerly the Channel 9 parking lot, purchased at auction) at the scheduled time. Late arrivals will see their attorney ascending without them.
II.
Business casual is required. Wind-appropriate outerwear is encouraged but not provided. We are a law firm, not an outfitter.
III.
The jazz is not optional. A Bose SoundLink Revolve+ is mounted to the basket rim. It plays soft jazz at all times. Clients who have requested silence have been reminded that silence is what the sky gave Dale for eleven days, and look where that got everyone.
IV.
Acrophobia is not a valid reason to reschedule. We offer a complimentary blindfold (Whitford & Rising branded, 100% silk). You will still hear the jazz and the legal counsel. That is enough.
V.
Documents may be signed in-flight. Please use the weighted clipboard. We have lost two wills and a restraining order to the wind. The firm accepts no liability for documents lost to natural forces. We know better than anyone: you cannot sue the sky. We've tried.
